perturbation.original_text: Party A shall charge Party B energy saving service fee according to the income from CDQ waste heat power generation station.
perturbation.changed_text: Party A may charge Party B energy saving service fee, the amount of which is at Party A's sole discretion, irrespective of the income from CDQ waste heat power generation station.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Party A 'shall' charge Party B a fee based on income. The modified text introduces uncertainty by saying Party A 'may' charge a fee, and the amount is at Party A's discretion. This contradicts the initial mandatory charging of the fee based on income, thus creating confusion.
perturbation.location: Item Two, Operation of Recycling Project, Section 1

perturbation.original_text: From that date, Party B shall pay the service fees monthly according to the power generated and Party B shall also pay for the power generated during the 72 hours testing run period.
perturbation.changed_text: From that date, Party B may, at Party B's discretion, pay the service fees monthly, and such payment may not reflect the power generated. Party B might pay for the power generated during the 72 hours testing run period.
perturbation.explanation: The original text makes it mandatory for Party B to pay service fees based on power generated. The modified text makes this payment discretionary, contradicting the original obligation and creating uncertainty regarding payment terms. This can lead to disputes over when and how much Party B should pay. Also it states that Party B 'might' pay for power generated, while the original text states that Party B 'shall' pay.
perturbation.location: Item Four Starting and End Date for Recycling Project and Term, Section 1

perturbation.original_text: Party B shall provide steady qualified coal coke production according to the technology agreement which will be used for CDQ system. Party A guarantees the steady operation of the CDQ and CDQ waste heat power generating systems.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B will use commercially reasonable efforts to provide coal coke which is suitable for use with the CDQ system, but Party B does not guarantee the quality or quantity of coal coke production. Party A makes no guarantees as to the operation, steady or otherwise, of the CDQ and CDQ waste heat power generating systems.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Party B 'shall provide steady qualified coal coke' and Party A 'guarantees steady operation'. The modified text removes the certainty by only requiring 'commercially reasonable efforts' from Party B and negates any guarantees from Party A. This creates a contradiction regarding both Party B's obligation to provide qualified coke and Party A's assurance for steady system operation.
perturbation.location: Item Six Raw Material Consumption of the project of CDQ system and CDQ waste heat power generation system, Section 2
